page.title: 04IVYTON FARM
page.content: This farmer has been on Ivyton farm for 30 years and his father before him and his father before him. This stretches back to 1916. Since he began farming it has changed quite a lot. The use of fertilizer and the introduction of new crops have increased production a great deal. More people have also come to work on the farm so work is done more quickly. The work is not particularly difficult as it is on the edge of the Quantocks, but the hill slopes can make things awkward. In the winter it gets very difficult when you have to feed the animals twice a day Altogether there are 325 acres and 200 acres are ploughed. This farm is a grade 3 farm which is below average. There are 3 enterprises- 100 acres of corn, 100 acres of beef cattle and the rest ploughed.
